pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:0.3_0: The chapter on offenses entailing relinquishment
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.11_0: “People have been teasing me because of this wool.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.12_0: “But how far have you carried it?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.14_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Devadatta,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.15_0: “How can a monk carry wool more than 40 kilometers?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.16_0: After rebuking that monk in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned that monk:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.17_0: “Is it true, monk, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.20_0: “... Foolish man, how can you carry wool more than 40 kilometers?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.21_0: Foolish man, this won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.22_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.23.1_0: ‘If wool is given to a monk who is traveling, he may give wool.’
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.23.1_1: if he wishes, he may receive it.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.24_0: If he receives it and there is no one else to carry it, he may carry it himself for at most 40 kilometers.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.25_0: If he carries it further than that, even if there is no one else to carry it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.2_0: At that time a certain monk who was walking through the Kosalan country on his way to Sāvatthī was given some wool.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.3_0: He bound it into a bundle with his upper robe and went on.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.4_0: When people saw him, they teased him,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.5_0: “Venerable, how much did this cost you?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.6_0: How much will the profit be?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.7_0: As a result he was humiliated.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.8_0: When he arrived at Sāvatthī, he threw the wool to the ground.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.10_0: there is no other person who can carry it, either a woman or a man, either a lay person or a monastic.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.11_0: If he carries it further than that, even if there is no one else to carry it:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.12_0: if he crosses the threshold with the first foot, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.13_0: When he goes beyond with the second foot, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.14_0: If he stands within the 40 kilometer limit, but drops it beyond the 40 kilometer limit, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.15_0: If he places it in the vehicle or among the goods of another without their knowledge, and it goes more than 40 kilometers, it becomes subject to relinquishment.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.16_0: The bowl should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.17_0: And it should be done like this.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.19_0: ‘Venerables, this wool which I have taken more than 40 kilometers is to be relinquished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.1_0: To a monk who is traveling:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.20_0: I don’t relinquish them to the Sangha.’ ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.23_0: ‘I give these tonics back to you.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.24.1_0: If he takes it more than 40 kilometers and he perceives it as more, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.25_0: If he takes it more than 40 kilometers, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.26_0: If he takes it more than 40 kilometers, but he perceives it as less, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.27_0: If he takes it less than 40 kilometers, but he perceives it as more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.28_0: If he takes it less than 40 kilometers, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.29_0: If he takes it less than 40 kilometers and he perceives it as less, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.32_0: if he carries it less than 40 kilometers;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.33_0: if he carries it 40 kilometers and then carries it back;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.34_0: if he takes it 40 kilometers with the intention of staying there, but then takes it further;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.35_0: if he gets back what had been taken from him and then carries it on;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.36_0: if he gets back what he had given up and then carries it on;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.37_0: if he gets someone else to carry it;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.38_0: if it is a finished article;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.41_0: The sixth rule, the training rule on wool, is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.4_0: if it is given by the Sangha, by a group, by a relative, by a friend, or if it is discarded wool, or if it is by means of his own property.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.6_0: if he desires, he may receive it.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.7_0: If he receives it, he may carry it himself for at most 40 kilometers:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.8_0: he may carry it himself no further than 40 kilometers.
